name: ComplyAdvantage
slogan: We're fixing anti-money laundering & compliance with smart tech and better data
description:
ComplyAdvantage is helping firms rethink how they combat financial crime and comply with regulations (specifically around Sanctions, AML and CTF). The team is on a personal mission to combat the rising threat of terrorism and fight the negative impact on society of money laundering.

ComplyAdvantage's proprietary, dynamic global database of individuals, organisations and all their connections, provides fresh insight into financial crime risks (e.g. Sanctions, Watchlists, Politically Exposed Persons, Adverse Media). ComplyAdvantage's screening platform helps to safely automate the risk assessment of customers and transactions, and their real-time analytics enable firms to monitor customer activity and spot suspicious behaviours.

ComplyAdvantage uses machine learning and big data coupled with a tailored risk-based approach to help a wide range of insurance companies and financial institutions improve automation, reduce manual work (‘false positives’) and make decisions faster.

team.name: Merve Beyatli
team.bioHtml: Talent Acquisition & HR Partner at ComplyAdvantage

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solutions. We are building solutions that help reveal the truth for a safer world and stop money ending up in the hands of terrorists.


How? By bringing together smart technology, data and people into a single solution. We are building tools that fight financial crime today to prevent a riskier tomorrow.


About us

Every day we look to tackle highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web-based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal financial activities. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing our Series B investment round of $30mln led by Index Ventures and tripling our revenue year-on-year, we’re growing fast and are looking for the best people to join us.


Our culture

Fresh Thinkers - We’re big thinking, boundary breakers, providing innovative solutions not corporate fixes.

Problem Solvers - We’re constantly curious and instinctively clever, always striving to be faster and better.

People People - We’re the human side of risk and compliance, we care about the people behind the screens.


The role

We are looking for an expert engineer to join our AML Screening and Monitoring team. You’ll have experience developing systems at scale and handling large volumes of data.

* Responsible for working with the engineering and product teams to design, implement and support features and components for our screening platform.
* Responsible in developing various REST framework services handling large volumes of data
* You will iterate over the existing codebase to enhance with new components or refactor into discrete sub-components/services in order to address some of the enterprise grade requirements
* You will work with databases at scale and provide solutions as appropriate
* Effectively communicate the relevant updates and queries with other stakeholders (designers, delivery and product team and other development teams)
* Understand, extend and modify complex logic with many technical dependencies and consequences
* You will be a strong believer in DevOps and are comfortable with getting into the details of infrastructure and deployment
* You will own your code - you build it, you ship it, you run it - and you will be a champion of this throughout the team or teams you work with
* Provide leadership, coaching and mentoring to more junior engineers and help them to become as good as you are

What does success look like after 6 months?

* You will have a clear overview of the screening platform codebase and components that your squad will be working on
* You have a good understanding of the product business and technical roadmap and the initiatives around making screening platform an enterprise grade solution and technical implications around these
* You have helped refactor and migrate existing complex application to better defined services and components
* You have made several high-quality, tested contributions to the code-base that are in use by clients on production environments
* You have supervised other team members and provided them with the support and coaching for them to grow

Requirements

We’re looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

* Extensive knowledge of data structures, algorithms, complexity and optimisation strategies
* Whilst this position will require you to work in Python, previous experience is not required - if you're a strong developer in Java, C++, C# or .NET and are willing to switch languages, then we'd love to hear from you
* Experience with MongoDB, ElasticSearch or some other distributed data storage system
* Exposure to designing enterprise grade applications
* Experience working with cloud based systems and ideally be familiar with cloud technologies and containers
* Strong understanding of code development principles and practices, including source control, code reviews, testing, etc.
* Ability to provide technical leadership to a team (2-5 people), mentor and coach them in skills development
* Most likely minimum degree-level education in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or relevant

Benefits

We’re a rapidly growing team of engineers, data scientists, testers, designers, researchers, and technology enthusiasts, passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime


The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Whatever it takes - ...

jobs.title: Software Test Automation Developer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented Software Test Automation Developer to help us ensure the quality of the data and software that our clients use to detect and prevent financial crime.

About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.


The role

As a Test Automation you will make an impact in the real world using exciting and new technology. You will work under the guidance of a more senior to develop the test scripting & test results required. You are a strong enough developer to write feature code, strong enough tester to test just about anything, and a strong advocate for maintaining a high quality bar.

Your passion in problem-solving and expertise in test automation, coding and scripting will bring the best experiences possible. We believe that the role of QA isn't to block releases or act as a gatekeeper, but to collaborate with developers and product teams to continually improve the product.


What does success look like in 12 months?

* Partner with developers and test engineers to improve and automate test and release processes
* Make testing an integral part of the development process
* Build and maintain tooling and infrastructure
* Communicate with product, design and technical stakeholders
* Contribute to the long term vision and strategy in your domain of expertise
* Engage with the wider testing community at ComplyAdvantage to share knowledge and help implement strategic improvements
* Maintain an understanding of industry testing tools/patterns/frameworks/processes and presenting back to the wider ComplyAdvantage testing community

Requirements

* Experience with a programming or scripting language - preferably Python or JavaScript, but we’re also interested if you’re familiar with other languages
* Experience in automated testing of services including multiple browser interfaces and APIs
* Experience in working on large code bases
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high quality code
* You have a passion for test infrastructure and CI/CD

Bonus Points If

* Experience incorporating automated test into build and release process
* Experience in building automated test tools for front end applications
* Know your way around API Stubbing

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme
* Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: AML Sales Consultant, APAC
jobs.description:
Note: Applications without a cover letter will not be considered

The role

We’re looking for a Regulatory Technology Sales Consultant to develop our presence and sell our SAAS solutions within the Banking, Payments and Financial Services sector. You will be supported by significant investment in marketing lead generation activity and a highly capable internal business development team. However, we are looking for candidate prepared to prospect relentlessly to build a high quality pipeline. Given the early stage of this business in Asia we are also looking for candidates who can help to shape the vision, strategy and deliver vital feedback on product positioning and new features and ideas. It’s a proactive, high-energy, fast-paced environment but we’ll give you the support you need to thrive.


About us

We're a high-growth Fintech SAAS early stage company that uses big data analytics and cutting edge technology to revolutionise the way companies protect themselves from criminals, terrorists and money launderers.

We’re a small, but rapidly growing team that’s passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime. We’ve spent over two years shaping our products and sales are now really starting to take off – we’re already helping a large numbers of businesses process billions of pounds and reduce risk, and we’re now looking to build our foundation team to take us to the next level.


Responsibilities

* Generate new opportunities from existing customer referrals and through building partnerships as well as from your own targeted outbound activity into larger prospects
* Effectively manage pipeline of opportunities
* Engage with senior decision makers in financial services companies (and others), educate them on our product features and benefits and negotiate and close deals
* Deliver new business target against a quarterly quota
* Support client on-boarding as required
* Contribute towards on-boarding and training of the lead generation and junior sales team, through best practice sharing and coaching

Requirements

The ideal candidate

* Experience in AML/Compliance/PEP-Sanctions/Transaction Monitoring
* Smart, ambitious and motivated individual that doesn’t take themselves too seriously
* Passionate self-starter that is self-directed and able to execute independently
* Strong team spirit and able to work effectively in collaboration with others
* Track record in generating new business within a corporate B2B sales environment - we are only interested in speaking with individuals that can demonstrate self-sufficient success and the ability to find, manage and close high-value deals with major brands
* Minimum of 4 years sales experience, with at least two in a solution selling environment preferably in B2B compliance/regulatory, or other cloud/SaaS solutions for the financial services industry
* Extensive training, ideally in the Sandler system
* Keen commercial instinct to determine which opportunities to prioritise
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills (fluent in English) and consultative approach to close business
* Hungry to develop their skills and take on more responsibilities quickly – our ambitious expansion plans mean we’re looking for new leaders to help us grow


Benefits

* Full time role based in our Singapore office, but with flexibility to work remotely part of the week
* Competitive salary based on experience with six monthly review for potential increases
* Generous commissions and bonuses (uncapped)
* Share option scheme

jobs.title: Business Development Representative, New York
jobs.description:
SaaS/RegTech start-up – Business Development Representative, huge opportunity to learn and impact, rapid career progression, ambitious international growth plans.


About us

We've turned our passion, advanced big data analytics and cutting-edge technology into a high-growth RegTech SAAS company revolutionizing the way companies protect themselves from criminals, terrorists and money launderers.

We already work with some 200 clients in the financial markets and other regulated and high-risk sectors, helping them make intelligent choices when complying with regulations relating to sanctions, money laundering (AML), terrorist financing (CFT), bribery and corruption.

Our unique proprietary database provides dynamic real-time insight into financial crime risks. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and big data analytics, we help firms manage their compliance and risk obligations, but more importantly, detect and prevent the occurrence of financial crime, child labor, and modern day slavery.

Founded in 2014 and headquartered in NYC with offices in London, and Cluj, we recently completed $30m Series B funding led by Balderton Capital. Most recently the firm was recognized in CityAM’s 20 Digital Innovators and TechWorld’s Nine RegTech Firms to Watch.

We’re a rapidly growing team, with a flat hierarchy, that’s totally determined and focused on doing whatever it takes to be the market leader in our space.

The role

We’re looking for a Business Development Representative to develop our presence and sell our SAAS solutions within the Banking and Financial Services sector in the US.

You’ll be working with our clients closely to solve their real life business problems. It’s a proactive, high-energy, fast-paced environment where you’ll be given the support and training you need to thrive.

Responsibilities

Success in this role will mean:

* Strengthening financial institutions' protection against money launderers and terrorist financiers
* Helping customers to gain a competitive advantage through their compliance processes
* Fueling ComplyAdvantage's growth and market presence in the US
* Taking on, and winning deals against, large incumbents


You'll be measured on your ability to generate leads, qualify opportunities and close deals, and to achieve this you'll be:

* Setting ambitious weekly sales activity quotas and use the CRM to document and achieve them
* Generating leads using the latest techniques and tools, including leveraging marketing content via social media channels, attending marketing events, and generating referrals through networks
* Finding and engaging with senior decision makers in financial services companies (and others), understanding their compliance needs/processes, educating them on our product features and benefits, and qualifying the potential opportunities
* Managing and prioritizing inbound and outbound leads
* Sharing market intelligence with marketing and senior management to help drive future strategic decisions. The more senior you become, the more insights turn into proposals for expedited business growth
* Negotiating and closing deals with prospects - we give our business development team significant responsibility, and you won't be stuck behind the phone all day
* Supporting client on-boarding, as required, and leveraging relationships to source new leads within existing clients
* Contributing towards training materials and supporting on-boarding training for future employees as the company expands

Requirements

The ideal candidate

* Continually improves: you're smart, ambitious, motivated and coachable - you don’t take yourself too seriously, you try new things and learn from others.
* Gets things done: you're passionate, a self-starter, take the initiative and capable of execute independently.
* Improves the team: you have a strong team spirit and are able to work effectively in collaboration with others.
* Has a B2B track record: you must have a proven track record in generating new business within a corporate B2B sales environment, with a minimum of of 12 months in a lead generation/sales or growth hacking role, preferably in B2B cloud/SaaS software or financial services/compliance.
* Can prove themselves: back up your experience with clear evidence of direct business wins generated through your previous work – with the successes, failures, and numbers to prove it. Include proof of operational experience in using social media and the latest techniques to develop interest from leads, whether self-generated or given to you.
* Has a commercial mind: you'll have a keen commercial sense on which opportunities to prioritize..
* Communicates skillfully: opening, pursuing and closing opportunities requires excellent communication and negotiation skills (fluent in English, for a start) and a consultative approach to closing business. If you're fluent in Spanish in Spanish or Portuguese, that helps too - we want to take on the Latin American markets, and we want you...

jobs.title: Data Strategist
jobs.description:
ComplyAdvantage is a venture-backed startup using artificial intelligence to fight terrorism and financial crime. We are in a rapid growth phase and we’re currently looking for a senior researcher to drive forward our coverage of international watchlists and politically exposed individuals.

We're looking to solve some interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the innovative use of technology & design and we’re disrupting the compliance industry while doing so.

Requirements

We’re looking for a Data Strategist to join our product data strategy team. We need someone to help us with improving the data coverage and manage the data flow. Dealing with a large database (with a fast pace of updating) you will be mainly focused on collecting and reviewing the accuracy of specific data sets. The data collected will be relevant to the Anti Money Laundering, Counter Terrorist Financing and Anti-Bribery & Corruption fields ranging from sanctioned entities to politically exposed people. You will be a part of the product team and work closely with engineering to ensure we exceed client expectations in relation to our data coverage and quality. We value those who take initiative and pride in their work and thrive in an informal working environment.


Ideally, you will:

* Have a love for data analysis and deeply believe in evidence-based decision making, thus you should be familiar with at least one of Microsoft Excel, Access, or another database or spreadsheet application
* Have an understanding of how HTML, RegEx work, i.e. so you would be able to create Xpaths for selecting what you want to extract from a certain website
* Be commercially-aware and have the ability to plan work in order to meet deadlines
* Have an outstanding level of attention to details
* Be a great team player. In our company we support each other, thus we need someone that can easily integrate with the other members of the team
* Be eager to learn new things and be in a continuous process of improving yourself

Benefits


The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Whatever it takes - we compete as a team, and win (or lose) as a team.
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Work together effectively - be respectful, socially inclusive and friendly. Decision making should be inclusive.

Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme

* Generous annual leave arrangements

The data collected will be relevant to the Anti Money Laundering, Counter Terrorist Financing and Anti-Bribery & Corruption fields ranging from sanctioned entities to politically exposed people. You will be a part of the product team and work closely with engineering to ensure we exceed client expectations in relation to our data coverage and quality. We value those who take initiative and pride in their work and thrive in an informal working environment.

Ideally, you will:

  • Have a love for data analysis and deeply believe in evidence-based decision making, thus you should be familiar with at least one of Microsoft Excel, Access, or another database or spreadsheet application
  • Have an understanding of how HTML, RegEx work, i.e. so you would be able to create Xpaths for selecting what you want to extract from a certain website
  • Be commercially-aware and have the ability to plan work in order to meet deadlines
  • Have an outstanding level of attention to details
  • Be a great team player. In our company we support each other, thus we need someone that can easily integrate with the other members of the team
  • Be eager to learn new things and be in a continuous process of improving yourself

Benefits

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

  • Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
  • Whatever it takes - we compete as a team, and win (or lose) as a team.
  • Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
  • Work together effectively - be respectful, socially inclusive and friendly. Decision making should be inclusive.

Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours
  • Private health insurance
  • Meal tickets

  • Share options scheme

  • Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: Test Engineer (London)
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented Test Engineer to help us ensure the quality of the data and software that our clients use to detect and prevent financial crime.

About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.


The role

You will work within a cross-functional team on a range of tasks including:

* Work closely with the software engineering team - quality is the responsibility of the team!
* Build an automation framework using Python
* Design, develop and execute automation scrips
* Collaborate with Engineers and Product Managers to create test cases for key product features
* Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
* Design, develop and execute automation scripts using automation tools
* Run regression tests when bugs are resolved
* Maintain a log of all test cases and test results
* Ensure that all tests are executed and give regular feedback to the team lead on the status of quality

What does success look like in 12 months?

* You will have developed a TA framework which is easy to maintain and run.
* You will have designed and created tests that cover the key functionality for a continuous delivery pipeline
* You will have strong understanding of the company and product, and you will be able to use your automation experience on various projects within the company.
* Depending on your experience, you have supervised one or more other engineers and provided them with the support and coaching for them to grow.

Requirements

Does this sound like you?

* Outstanding knowledge of testing fundamentals
* Strong knowledge of a programming or scripting language - Python or JavaScript is useful, but we’re also interested if you’re familiar with other languages
* Experience with one or more test automation tools or frameworks
* Most likely a degree-level education in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or some other related course

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days' holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme

jobs.title: AML Sales Consultant, Canada
jobs.description:
Note: Applications without a cover letter will not be considered

The role

We’re looking for a Regulatory Technology Sales Consultant to develop our presence and sell our SAAS solutions within the Banking, Payments and Financial Services sector. You will be supported by significant investment in marketing lead generation activity and a highly capable internal business development team. However, we are looking for candidate prepared to prospect relentlessly to build a high quality pipeline. Given the early stage of this business in Canada, we are looking for candidates who can help to shape the vision, strategy and deliver vital feedback on product positioning and new features and ideas. It’s a proactive, high-energy, fast-paced environment but we’ll give you the support you need to thrive.


About us

We're a high-growth Fintech SAAS early stage company that uses big data analytics and cutting edge technology to revolutionize the way companies protect themselves from criminals, terrorists and money launderers.

We’re a small, but rapidly growing team that’s passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime. We’ve spent over two years shaping our products and sales are now really starting to take off – we’re already helping a large numbers of businesses process billions of pounds and reduce risk, and we’re now looking to build our foundation team to take us to the next level.


Responsibilities

* Generate new opportunities from existing customer referrals and through building partnerships as well as from your own targeted outbound activity into larger prospects
* Effectively manage pipeline of opportunities
* Engage with senior decision makers in financial services companies (and others), educate them on our product features and benefits and negotiate and close deals
* Deliver new business target against a quarterly quota
* Support client on-boarding as required
* Contribute towards on-boarding and training of the lead generation and junior sales team, through best practice sharing and coaching

Requirements

The ideal candidate

* Experience in AML/Compliance/PEP-Sanctions/Transaction Monitoring
* Smart, ambitious and motivated individual that doesn’t take themselves too seriously
* Passionate self-starter that is self-directed and able to execute independently
* Strong team spirit and able to work effectively in collaboration with others
* Track record in generating new business within a corporate B2B sales environment - we are only interested in speaking with individuals that can demonstrate self-sufficient success and the ability to find, manage and close high-value deals with major brands
* Minimum of 4 years sales experience, with at least two in a solution selling environment preferably in B2B compliance/regulatory, or other cloud/SaaS solutions for the financial services industry
* Extensive training (Sandler or Challenger system)
* Keen commercial instinct to determine which opportunities to prioritize
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills (fluent in English and French) and consultative approach to close business
* Hungry to develop their skills and take on more responsibilities quickly – our ambitious expansion plans mean we’re looking for new leaders to help us grow


Benefits

* Competitive salary based on experience
* Generous commissions and bonuses (uncapped)
* Share option scheme

jobs.title: AML Sales Team Lead (Player/Manager)
jobs.description:
The role

We’re looking for a Regulatory Technology Sales Team Lead to ramp up sales of our unique SAAS solutions; you will be responsible for your own quote as well as leading a team of 4 sales consultants. You will be supported by significant investment in marketing lead generation activity and a highly capable internal business development team. However, we are looking for candidate prepared to prospect relentlessly to build a high quality pipeline. It is a proactive, high-energy, fast-paced environment where we will give you the support you need to thrive.

About us

We're a high-growth Fintech SAAS early stage company that uses big data analytics and cutting edge technology to revolutionise the way companies protect themselves from criminals, terrorists and money launderers.

We are a small but rapidly growing team of bar-raisers who are passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime. We’ve spent over two years shaping our products and we are now rapidly accelerating revenue growth out of our UK, European, Singapore and New York offices. We are already helping hundreds of businesses seamlessly onboard customers and process transactions whilst helping them reduce the risk of funding terrorists or facilitating money laundering. Our cutting edge technology is changing the standards of the compliance industry and people in the know want to know us. We are now building the team that will take us to the next level.

Responsibilities

Generate new opportunities from targeted outbound activity, networking and referrals
Engage with senior decision makers, qualify opportunities, negotiate and close deals
Effectively manage pipeline, prioritise the right deals and create urgency
Consistently overachieve upon new business target against a quarterly quota
Feedback valuable market and product intelligence to our Product and Strategy teams
Lead & manage, including on-boarding and training, of a sales team

Requirements:
Track record in generating new business within a corporate B2B sales environment - we are only interested in speaking with individuals that can demonstrate self-sufficient success and the ability to find, manage and close high-value deals with major brands
Minimum of 5 years sales experience, with at least two in a solution selling environment preferably in B2B compliance/regulatory, or other cloud/SaaS solutions for the financial services industry
EITHER: experience of selling AML solutions; OR experience of building out a territory from scratch
Smart, ambitious and motivated individual who doesn’t take themselves too seriously
Passionate self-starter who is self-directed and able to execute independently
Target-oriented, highly motivated individual who wants to win whilst always doing the right thing for the customer and for ComplyAdvantage
Creative-thinker who is willing to try new things to get the best results; thinks quickly and thrives in an entrepreneurial environment
Strong team spirit and enjoys working effectively in collaboration with others
Experience in AML/Compliance/PEP-Sanctions/Transaction Monitoring sales is extremely desirable
Keen executor of a standardised sales process, ideally leveraging a known methodology e.g. Sandler, Challenger.
Excellent communication and negotiation skills and a consultative approach to close business
Willingness to travel for 5-15 days per month to visit clients and prospects
Hungry to develop their skills and take on more responsibilities quickly – our ambitious expansion plans mean we’re looking for new leaders to help us grow

Benefits:
Full time role based in our London office
Competitive salary based on experience
Generous commissions and bonuses (uncapped)
Share option scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Travel loan

jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.description:
DESCRIPTION
We are looking for a talented Engineering Manager to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solutions to help organizations fight financial crime. We are building solutions that help reveal the truth for a safer world and stop money ending up in the hands of terrorists. You will join and guide the Transaction Monitoring team, being involved in scaling the Transaction Monitoring team successfully as it doubles in size and takes on multiple streams of execution.


The Role

We are looking for an expert Engineering Manager to join and lead our Transaction Monitoring team. You'll get involved in scaling the team successfully as it doubles in size and takes on multiple streams of execution.
You will be responsible for managing 2-3 cross-functional squads.
You will work closely with the PM to ensure that the right environment is created for the team to build and deliver quality software to fight financial crime for some of the biggest names in the business.
You will ensure that best practices are being adopted for quality delivery and operation of software.
You will be responsible for driving improvements of capabilities of squad and tribe as a whole
You will be responsible in developing and supporting a world-class tech team, carrying out regular performance reviews, career growth plans, hiring great people into the team and overall ensuring satisfaction and happiness across the team
What does success look like after 3 months
You will have have worked with the team and PM to formulate a road-map to scale the product to the next level.
You will have led the team through a number of successful iterative release cycles, with the aim of moving towards a fully continuous delivery model
You will have hired and on-boarded great developers to scale the team.

REQUIREMENTS
We’re looking for a smart and motivated person that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be sure of your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

You will have most likely have a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or other numerate field with around 8 years professional experience
You will have led at least 1 team of 5 - 8 developers for at least 1 - 2 years, preferably more than 1 team.
You will have previously driven improvements in capabilities of the teams you've managed, ensuring technical quality remains top class
You will have showcased your ability to work closely with product managers, product owners and other engineering managers
Ideally you will have worked in a start-up before, SaaS and worked with remote teams/developers.

BENEFITS
Competitive salary
Options
25 days' holiday
Flexible working hours
Company pension scheme
Company health care plan
Season ticket loan
Cycle to work scheme
£2000 training and development budget

jobs.title: Financial Crime Analyst
jobs.description:
Financial Crime Analyst

We are looking for a financial crime analyst at ComplyAdvantage to join our financial crime team and help with our mission to stamp out corruption and prevent money ending up in the hands of terrorists.

About us

At ComplyAdvantage, we’re building solutions that help reveal the truth for better business and a safer world.

As businesses spend billions on trying to know who a person is, we’re turning the tables on risk with a new and better way.

How? By bringing together smart technology, data and people into a single solution. We are building tools that fight financial crime today, to prevent a riskier tomorrow.

After securing our Series B investment round and tripling our revenue year on year, we’re growing fast and are looking for the best people to join us.

Our Culture

Fresh Thinkers - We’re big thinking, boundary breakers, providing innovative solutions not corporate fixes

Problem Solvers - We’re constantly curious and instinctively clever, always striving to be faster and better
People People - We’re the human side of risk and compliance, we care about the people behind the screens

The role

What you will do:

* Work with teams across the company to provide financial crime knowledge and expertise
* Be the voice of the customer for product teams to understand user needs and preferences
* Work with marketing to deliver content in both long and short form, and provide regular updates on regulatory and industry developments
* Conduct research into regulation, financial services and financial crime technology
* Help build a community of clients and future clients
* Work with our customers to understand their needs, guide them as to industry best practice, and ensure they are using our platform to maximum effect
* Produce and deliver training internally

What does success look like in 12 months?

* You will have contributed to a product vision and roadmap that is strongly informed by regulatory requirements and needs within institutions within financial services
* You will have ensured ComplyAdvantage is seen as an industry expert and a go-to source of information, guidance and developments in financial crime
* Expertise exists and is disseminated internally to ensure all teams are highly skilled and knowledgeable regarding financial crime


Requirements

Requirements

* You hold a degree in a relevant subject like politics, finance, economics etc.
* 1-3 years experience in financial crime / financial technology
* In depth knowledge of financial crime regulation on an international level
* Strong communicator

Benefits

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme

Everything we do is greenfield - joining us at the stage means your work will have a visible impact on the future of ComplyAdvantage.

jobs.title: Front-end Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented Front-end Engineer to lead the design and implementation of the front-end of our transaction monitoring platform. You'll have ownership in the technical project to design, plan and ensure the best technologies and tools are used for the job.

About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us do this.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.

The role

* You will be responsible for designing and implementing the client-side of our cutting-edge anti money-laundering platform
* You'll work out clear and interesting ways of presenting complex and sophisticated numeric and qualitative data to decision makers
* The role includes technology and framework selection, architecture and implementation
* You'll collaborate closely with our product and design teams and back-end engineers


What does success look like In your first 12 months?

* You have taken co-ownership of the Transaction Monitoring project and all stages of the front end development process. You have delivered new features and improvements on time with outstanding quality.
* You have gained a deep understanding of the users, business and technology beyond the project. You are always mindful of quality attributes like maintainability, performance, security, scalability, usability and testability. As a result, you have successfully contributed to architecture and UI/UX proposals and decisions.
* Your designs and implementation are clean, elegant, and easily understood by other team members. You add complexity where it is needed, but no more than what is required.
* You are continuously researching tools, technologies, frameworks and practices. You are able to distinguish between what is hyped and what is valuable, and you have pertinent arguments in favor of your proposals.
* You can guide the team towards the established objectives. Your colleagues have come to value your technical advice, and you are able to identify technical and soft skills areas that need improving.

Requirements

We value those who take initiative and pride in their work and contribute to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

* Extensive experience working with JavaScript including knowledge of one or more front-end frameworks such as Angular, React etc...
* A sound understanding of Javascript application best practices.
* The ability to build a client-side application to enterprise grade
* Most likely a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or other numerate field.

Benefits

Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days' holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a talented Front-end Engineer to lead the design and implementation of the front-end of our transaction monitoring platform. You'll have ownership in the technical project to design, plan and ensure the best technologies and tools are used for the job.

About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us do this.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

  • Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
  • Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
  • Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
  • Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.

The role

  • You will be responsible for designing and implementing the client-side of our cutting-edge anti money-laundering platform
  • You'll work out clear and interesting ways of presenting complex and sophisticated numeric and qualitative data to decision makers
  • The role includes technology and framework selection, architecture and implementation
  • You'll collaborate closely with our product and design teams and back-end engineers

What does success look like In your first 12 months?

  • You have taken co-ownership of the Transaction Monitoring project and all stages of the front end development process. You have delivered new features and improvements on time with outstanding quality.
  • You have gained a deep understanding of the users, business and technology beyond the project. You are always mindful of quality attributes like maintainability, performance, security, scalability, usability and testability. As a result, you have successfully contributed to architecture and UI/UX proposals and decisions.
  • Your designs and implementation are clean, elegant, and easily understood by other team members. You add complexity where it is needed, but no more than what is required.
  • You are continuously researching tools, technologies, frameworks and practices. You are able to distinguish between what is hyped and what is valuable, and you have pertinent arguments in favor of your proposals.
  • You can guide the team towards the established objectives. Your colleagues have come to value your technical advice, and you are able to identify technical and soft skills areas that need improving.

Requirements

We value those who take initiative and pride in their work and contribute to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

  • Extensive experience working with JavaScript including knowledge of one or more front-end frameworks such as Angular, React etc...
  • A sound understanding of Javascript application best practices.
  • The ability to build a client-side application to enterprise grade
  • Most likely a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or other numerate field.

Benefits

Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

  • Competitive salary
  • Share options scheme
  • 25 days' holiday
  • Flexible working hours
  • Company pension scheme
  • Company health care plan
  • Season ticket loan
  • Cycle to work scheme

jobs.title: Head of Product Marketing
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a brilliant, creative Product Marketer to join us as Head of Product Marketing as we head into our next phase of growth at ComplyAdvantage. We are looking for someone who has 4+ years experience in B2B product marketing within a high-growth tech start up.


About us

Every day we solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed data-centric, SaaS products that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing Series A in a funding round led by Balderton Capital, and tripling our revenue each year, we are now scaling the business globally into international markets.


To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us. Our values include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we compete as a team, and win (or lose) as a team.
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.


The role

You will be responsible for heading up Product Marketing at ComplyAdvantage. This is a hands-on role, but will include one direct report initially. As Head of Product Marketing you will be helping to translate what our product does and what the customer cares about into compelling stories and communications. You will lead on communicating the value proposition of our products in marketing and growth activities to attract new customers, nurture existing customers/prospects, drive product engagement and upsells. You will also build a close relationship with our Product team. It's vital you already have exposure to working closely with the same types of stakeholders in another tech business. On a day to day basis you will:


* Own and plan global product marketing campaigns and feature/launches
* Produce outstanding content that communicates client stories and the value proposition of our products to drive conversions throughout customer lifecycle. E.g. case studies, technical collateral, product factsheets/brochures, webinar presentations, guides, website content, workflow diagrams, videos.
* Help inspire, equip and train our sales team to engage and win new customers with sales tools that support the selling process
* Be the expert on our competition and how we can consistently win against them
* Be the expert on our buyers across target segments; understand what they care about, their buying criteria and what stories resonate with them.
* Project management, budgeting, testing and reporting on product marketing activity/campaigns
* Help shape our product marketing strategy; test and build value propositions and messaging, create go-to-market activities for priority segments as we expand and scale.


What does success look like in 12 months?

* You have created a suite of creative, compelling product collateral that excites our sales & product teams, delights our customers and has made a tangible impact on the sales process. Your content helps generate demand, drive traffic, build brand awareness, and optimize prospect interest and conversion.
* Your content reflects our brand values and is considered best in class - you know what type of content works best for different personas and segments along the customer journey to communicate the value and vision of our products.
* You have successfully communicated key launches from the product roadmap to our customers, and helped build a community of users in key markets.
* You have built great relationships across the company and collaborated closely with Product, Customer Success and Sales to ensure that the value proposition of our products is being communicated consistently and effectively, across regions and teams.
* You understand our products and what makes us different/better; our customers and their needs; our competitors and how to differentiate against them.
* Everyone at ComplyAdvantage is internally aligned about how to talk about what we’re building

Requirements

* At least 4-5 years experience in Product Marketing (ideally in B2B/SaaS/Technology)
* Ability to dive into our products and become a passionate champion
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to create and influence a wide variety of creative on-message assets
* Ability to tell compelling stories based on positioning and messaging
* Ability to understand technical language and translate to a non-technical audience
* Ability to present insights in a creative and informative way
* Ability to communicate visually and bring our product to life in a variety of mediums - e.g. written copy, website visuals, graphs, workflows, videos...

jobs.title: Head of Recruitment
jobs.description:
ComplyAdvantage has very ambitious growth plans on a global scale. We are looking for a Head of Recruitment who can not only manage a team of Talent Specialists, but can also work with senior management to help shape the future of our recruitment as a company. You will be working across, but not limited to: candidate experience, employer branding, global scaling, continuous training and development of the recruitment team.


About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.


After securing Series A in a funding round led by Balderton Capital, and tripling our revenue each year, we are now scaling the business globally into international markets.


To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!

Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures

Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.

Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.


What you will do

* Managing a team of 3+ recruiters, each with their own specialist area including tech, product, marketing and sales.
* Conducting 1:1 training and development within the recruitment team, further planning and growing the team as the company grows - making hires in the recruitment team with data-driven decisions.
* Taking ownership of recruitment tools - reviewing current tools and researching new ones which will allow the team to be more effective and successful in their recruitment process.
* Ownership of the recruitment team budget, working with the senior management team to define the budget and how it is spent.
* Creating hiring plans with the Talent Specialists across each of their teams and having full visibility of the company’s growth and recruitment plans.


What does success look like in 12 months?

* You will have defined our processes in line to achieve hiring goals for the company.
* You will have been able to shape the recruitment team to make the most effective hires across each of their recruitment disciplines including: technology, marketing, product and commercial.
* You have formulated a plan to enhance our employment branding and began to execute this.

Requirements

* Must have experience of recruiting in-house for a scaling business and managing a team of internal recruiters.
* Experience of recruiting within a technology focused company.
* Experience of scaling a company that has ambitious growth plans.
* Experience of creating and/or enhancing employer branding.

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme
* Childcare vouchers


Everything we do is greenfield - joining us at the stage means your work will have a visible impact on the future of ComplyAdvantage.

jobs.title: International Affairs Research Analyst
jobs.description:
ComplyAdvantage is a venture-backed startup using artificial intelligence to fight terrorism and financial crime. We are in a rapid growth phase and we’re currently looking for a senior researcher to drive forward our coverage of international watchlists and politically exposed individuals.

We're looking to solve some interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the innovative use of technology & design and we’re disrupting the compliance industry while doing so.

Requirements

We’re looking for an International Affairs Research Analyst to join our data analyst team and take ownership for our data coverage related to anti-money laundering (AML). This will be mainly focused on measuring and building out our coverage of individuals and companies featured in AML-relevant watchlists as well as politically exposed individuals (i.e. heads of state, members of parliament, senior judges). You will work closely with product and engineering to ensure we exceed client expectations in relation to our data coverage and quality. We value those who take initiative and pride in their work and thrive in an informal working environment.

Ideally, you will:

* Have excellent research skills and a desire to understand problems from first principles and fix issues holistically
* Have an outstanding level of attention to detail, and likely adopt a methodological approach to much of your analysis
* Have a love for data analysis and deep believe in evidence-based decision making
* Have a broad understanding of, and deep interest in, international politics and affairs
* Be commercially-aware and motivated to identify the best solution for client needs as well as prioritise work
* Enjoy working in a collaborative environment, have well-developed interpersonal skills and the ability to support and mentor your colleagues
* Be educated to at least Master’s degree level in a relevant discipline (international relations, foreign affairs, politics, history, etc.)

What does success look like In your first 12 months?

* Understand the coverage (quality & quantity) expectations of our clients and have a roadmap for making sure we meet and surpass those expectations
* Define metrics to measure quantity and quality of data for internal analysis as well as a subset that can be presented to clients
* You will have taken ownership of data quality and have a thorough knowledge of our relative strengths and weaknesses, and be actively involved in improving data coverage and quality

Benefits

We’re a rapidly growing team of engineers, data scientists, linguists, designers, researchers, and technology enthusiasts, passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime. We’ve spent the last couple of years shaping our products and sales are now really starting to take off – we’re already helping a large numbers of businesses process billions of pounds and reduce risk.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Whatever it takes - we compete as a team, and win (or lose) as a team.
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Work together effectively - be respectful, socially inclusive and friendly. Decision making should be inclusive.


Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme

* Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer (NLP)
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented NLP/ML Engineer to help us ensure the quality of the data and software that our clients use to detect and prevent financial crime

About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing Series A in a funding round led by Balderton Capital, and tripling our revenue each year, we are now scaling the business globally into international markets.

To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us do this.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.

What you will do

ComplyAdvantage is looking for a talented NLP Specialist to develop and improve the text analysis component of our platform. You will:

* Develop NLP-based algorithms
* Design and implement NLP systems
* Research new methods to solve problems
* Generate direct business value through NLP and ML
* Stay up to date with developments in the field of NLP and Machine Learning
* Specifically, you will need to use Named Entity Recognition, Relation Extraction, Entity Linking and other natural language processing and machine learning techniques in order to extract names and metadata of individuals from large data sets. You will be working as part of an engineering team, charged with harvesting and analysing as much data as we can make use of.

Requirements

Does this sound like you?

* You have deep understanding and experience of NLP and Machine Learning
* You can work well in a team with good communications skills
* You have a very clear, mathematical mind

* You have experience with Relation Extraction
* You are familiar with Python NLP/ML libraries like NLTK, scikit-learn, numpy, scipy, etc.
* You have degree (preferably Masters or PhD) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics or other related topic

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days' holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme

Everything we do is greenfield - joining us at the stage means your work will have a visible impact on the future of ComplyAdvantage.

jobs.title: Manager, BDR Team
jobs.description:
Note: Applications without a cover letter will not be considered


You will be responsible for shaping our BDR strategy while leading a diverse team of BDRs in reporting into the Head of Sales - America.


Responsibilities

* Set the business development priorities and key selling strategies to achieve sales objectives
* Define processes and procedures for the growing team of BDRs
* Drive adoption of a continuously improve the successful utilization of tools such as LinkedIn, Outreach and Gong
* Provides directional leadership for a fast growing team of BDRs
* Lead the daily activities and quota performance management of individual BDRs
* Consistently meets/exceeds outline individual and team metrics (quarterly and annually)
* Continue to build and strengthen your team through recruiting, hiring and development strategies
* Drive revenue through new client acquisition
* Develop strong social selling strategies and training for new and existing business development reps
* Encourage and motivate employees daily and bring innovation to the sales process to accelerate our market growth trajectory

Requirements

* 1+ years of sales management experience in a high-tech startup environment
* Consistent track record of consistently exceeding against quota and outlined metrics
* 1-2 years experience in sales or as an outbound BDR/SDR
* Experience working with Salesforce.com, Outreach (or equivalent), LinkedIn, Gong.io (or equivalent)
* An enthusiastic team player who’s comfortable working with all department leaders
* Knowledge of SaaS and/or subscription-based business sales models

* Experience leading a team of business development reps in consistently meeting goals
* Demonstrated track record of effectively hiring and motivating team members
* Ability to work in a dynamic, startup environment


Benefits

* Full time role based in our New York office, but with flexibility to work remotely part of the week
* Competitive salary based on experience
* Generous commissions and bonuses (uncapped)
* Share option scheme

jobs.title: Paid Internship Software Test Automation Developer
jobs.description:
We are looking for one or more interns to help us build and optimize our SaaS-based anti-money laundering systems.

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and build innovative tools for the compliance industry while doing so.

We are looking for one or more test software engineering interns to come and help us build out our applications and platforms.

What does success look like during your internship?

* You have written code that validates our products and data
* You found problems in our products and helped us fixing those
* You have familiarized yourself with our technology stack, and have detailed knowledge of how part of it works
* You have worked with other team members to develop new ideas and improve our products.

Requirements

Does this sound like you?

* You are passionate about technology and programming
* You believe a product is as good as its quality
* You have good problem solving capabilities
* You are able to work as part of a team, though also responsible enough that you can work independently.

What will I be doing?

We have a number of teams that are operating in diverse areas. We look to match each person’s interest and skills with the team and project that best matches what they do. Ultimately if you are passionate about technology, fascinated by what we do at ComplyAdvantage, and would enjoy working as part of a collaborative and high performing team, then please get in touch and we can discuss further.

How Long and when is the internship?

In the past internships have lasted anywhere from 2.5 months to 6 months. We find that 2.5 months is around the minimum time required for someone to have sufficient time to learn and deliver something of value.

We are looking to start in July and end in September for a 2.5 months period.

Our stack

* Python is our primary backend language. If you don’t have experience in Python then that’s ok - we’re comfortable with people from other backgrounds so long as you’re willing to give Python a go. And pytest, we love pytest.
* We are heavy users of AWS technologies
* We use a number of systems designed for large amounts of data - ElasticSearch, Kibana, MongoDB, Kafka and Hadoop to name a few
* The bucket list: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, many Python libraries and various third party products and platforms to optimise our development.

Our Teams

Our Platform team is responsible for providing the robust and scalable web applications to our clients. They eat high availability, four-nines and load balancers for breakfast.

Our Data Engineering team is responsible for ingesting, cleaning and processing our data collection processes and pipelines. They build systems to allow internal analysis, and manipulate it to ensure it provides the maximum functionality to our clients.

DevOps is the secret sauce of any great engineering team. They ensure everyone has access to the infrastructure and services they need and automate everything they can - database backups, environment replication, monitoring, logging and alerting, and sometimes even the coffee machine.

Benefits

We’re a high performing team of engineers, data scientists, linguists, designers and researchers passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Doing whatever it takes - we compete as a team, and win (or lose) as a team.
* Being results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Working together effectively - be respectful, socially inclusive and friendly. Decision making should be inclusive.

Previous interns have told us that they loved working with us at ComplyAdvantage because of the technology stack, great team, exciting and ambitious products. If you’d like to hear more then please get in touch!

jobs.title: Pre-Sales Engineer - EMEA
jobs.description:
The role

The Pre-Sales engineer is responsible for actively driving and managing the pre sales process with direct and channel customers. Demonstrating the ability to articulate the company’s technology and product portfolio, positioning to both business and technical users. Acting as an SME from a product, technical, and regulatory perspective across the ComplyAdvantage product offering, this is an exciting opportunity for an experienced industry professional with strong core technical skills and product knowledge to join and add value to a dedicated and friendly team. The role is based in the UK, with primary coverage in EMEA. Travel within the primary region of coverage may be required.

Requirements

About us

We're a high-growth Fintech SAAS early stage company that uses big data analytics and cutting edge technology to revolutionise the way companies protect themselves from criminals, terrorists and money launderers.

We’re a small, but rapidly growing team that’s passionate about using technology to reduce financial crime. We’ve spent over three years shaping our products and sales are now really starting to take off – we’re already helping a large numbers of businesses process billions of pounds and reduce risk, and we’re now looking to build our foundation team to take us to the next level


Key Responsibilities

* Working alongside our experienced AML sales Consultants, to attend meetings with potential key Clients to determine technical and business requirements and ensuring that all necessary information is collated prior to producing a solution
* Provide technical solutions in a professional manner and to agreed timeframes
* Create and confidently deliver technical presentations internally and externally
* Deliver training on solutions and provide product support to channel partners and internal stakeholders
* Prepare and present product demonstrations.
* Create internal design configuration documentation
* Identify, evaluate, and recommend proof of concept opportunities
* Work with Product Management to feedback on issues with current products and provide input around new products
* Builds productive relationships internally and externally, fostering teamwork by keeping colleagues updated on activities
* Able to understand business drivers and risks involved to the customer and ComplyAdvantage
* Sell technical solutions to the customer with professionalism and enthusiasm
* Provide accurate and timely management information, to include - activity reports, KPI’s
* To structure and produce compelling sales proposals/commercial and technical documentation outlining the cost savings and business benefits to clients of using ComplyAdvantage’s proposition


Requirements

* Bachelor’s degree or a combination of education and experience in engineering, information systems, or sciences
* 5+ years of industry experience, including two or more years in sales engineering or consulting
* Proven technology skills, outstanding interpersonal abilities, and strong written and verbal communication skills
* Attention to detail, plus analytical and problem-solving capabilities
* Experience with dealing with client IT teams as well as systems integrations
* Passionate self-starter that is self-directed and able to execute independently
* Technical understanding of API functionalities

Benefits

* Full time role based in our London office, but with flexibility to work remotely part of the week
* Competitive salary based on experience
* Generous commissions and bonuses
* Share option scheme

  • Technical understanding of API functionalities

Benefits

  • Full time role based in our New York office, but with flexibility to work remotely on occasion
  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Generous commissions and bonuses
  • Share option scheme

jobs.title: Product Analyst - Search
jobs.description:
We are looking for an outstanding Product Analyst to help define and guide our Search and Matching product. As a Product Analyst, you will work closely with your product’s Product Manager, the engineering teams, and commercial teams. You will provide critical insight supported by qualitative and quantitative analyses, be able to bridge understanding between technical and non-technical teams, and be able to push our product forward in order to provide the world’s leading name matching solution.


Our Product team sits at the heart of our organisation. They define what we build and why. As a result, our company's success is directly dependent on their ability to understand what direction we need to go.

We are a Product first company, employees are given very large degrees of responsibility, and we strive to achieve greater things together.


About us

Every day we look to solve highly challenging and interesting problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design, and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing Series A in a funding round led by Balderton Capital, a Series B with Index Ventures and tripling our revenue each year, we are now scaling the business globally into international markets.


To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us.


The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others for better decision making.


About our Search and Matching team:

The search team is a newly created squad at ComplyAdvantage. The team is meant to grow exponentially as our ambition is to be within the top 20% of the industry by the end of the year and to become a global standard in the next 3 to 5 years leveraging AI and linguistics. We enable our customers to find if the person they are onboarding present any risks while minimizing the number of false positives they have to review. The team is in a unique position as it services all products within ComplyAdvantage (from transaction monitoring to onboarding/screening) globally providing a lot of exciting opportunities around the world.


The team is composed of high calibre individuals from former startup leaders, entrepreneurs to PhDs/MBAs and is now waiting for you!

Requirements

What you will do:

* Define desirable tests through quantitative analysis of our name data (think: should Robert G Mugabe match Robert Mugabe?)
* Provide insights on how customers search for entities through quantitative and qualitative analysis of our search data (think: what is the most common typo financial institutions in UK do?)
* Linguistic research for specific countries/regions (think: should WANG Zhifu Ping match James Zhifu WANG?)
* Name equivalence research to enrich our name thesaurus (think: What are all the name variations of Steve?)
* Support the product roadmap, suggest new revenue ideas and potentially lead them from customer discovery to release
* Monitor the regulatory landscape related to name screening and enrich the search test library
* Review and analyze the competitor landscape
* Define sample analysis parameters performed by the Data Quality team and present conclusion to the squad
* Track and communicate metrics around search
* Product managing multiple components of the search product
* Working with product managers in other areas to ensure alignment on dependencies as we scale



What does success look like in 12 months?

* Have defined and validated a comprehensive set of desirable tests for name matching for enterprise customers
* Seen as a key contributor to the engineering team to help them prioritize and fine tune the search algorithm
* You have a deep understanding of our search products and how Financial Institutions test our product
* Seen as an expert on a key geographic area for name matching
* You deeply understand our users and their needs and have suggested features and improvement that proved valuable
* You have collaborated closely with Marketing and Sales to ensure that current and prospective clients understand the value of our products
* You’ve failed fast few times and learnt from it but succeeded most of the time


Requirements

* Experience working as a Product Analyst / Data Analyst / Business Analyst
* Experience in management consulting/technology/data-driven company is advantageous
* Quantitative tertiary education / demonstrated quantitative ability outside o...

jobs.title: Product Lead - New Initiatives
jobs.description:
We’re in a high-growth stage of our mission here at ComplyAdvantage - to rid the world of financial crime. We’re now adding a Product Manager (who will report to the VP of Product) to oversee the development of our new initiatives, and work with engineering teams using state of the art technology to build it.


About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.


We are a Fintech50 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fthefintech50.com%2F) startup, and we're ventured backed by two of the world’s best VC firms - Index Ventures and Balderton Capital. We’re quickly scaling the business globally into international markets. To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us.

The team values that we at ComplyAdvantage subscribe to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace kaizen
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making

Requirements

What you’ll do:

* Ensure we understand and are addressing our key customer needs in our new Product opportunities.
* Be responsible for the strategy, vision and success of our Corporate Onboarding product and new initiatives.
* Identify new product opportunities in this space, and new opportunities leveraging our technological capabilities.
* Report to the VP Product on key performance metrics and strategy


Requirements:

* You’ll have a track record of managing highly successful products within a product-centric company
* An understanding of AML/Compliance is desirable, but not essential for this role.
* Have worked with complex, data oriented products, and engineering teams using cutting-edge tech

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme
* Childcare vouchers
