jobs.title: Product Manager - AML Data
jobs.description:
We’re in a high-growth stage of our mission here at ComplyAdvantage - to rid the world of financial crime. We’re now adding a Product Manager (who will report to the Onboarding & Monitoring Product Lead) to oversee the development of our AML Data Product, including PEP (politically exposed persons), Sanction and Watchlist data, and work with engineering teams using state of the art technology to build it.


About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.


We are a Fintech50 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fthefintech50.com%2F) startup, and we're ventured backed by two of the world’s best VC firms - Index Ventures and Balderton Capital. We’re quickly scaling the business globally into international markets. To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us.


The team values that we at ComplyAdvantage subscribe to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace kaizen
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making

Requirements

What you’ll do:

* Visit customers and understanding their needs and pain points for AML purposes, mainly across Sanctions, Politically Exposed People (PEPs) and Watchlists
* Formulate data coverage & quality improvement strategy across our global database
* Understand future trends in AML risk-management and how these are relevant to the product roadmap
* Be the go-to point of contact for the business & external stakeholders for all things related to Sanctions. PEPs & Watchlists; working closely with a team of research analysts

Requirements:

* You will understand the Anti-Money Laundering & Counter Terrorist Financing risk-management regulatory landscape in which our clients operate
* You know the current issues in Financial Crime but also have a future vision and appreciation of trends as you regularly speak with financial services companies, regulators and industry thought-leaders
* You’ve previously synthesised an understanding of client needs and pain points (across a spectrum of sectors and geographies) into an easy-to-understand strategy and roadmap
* You will be able to show how you’ve led high-profile initiatives/projects/products and taken an ownership mentality. For example, you may have started something yourself or helped scale a fast-growing company


Nice-to-have Experience:

* Demonstrated product management skills in a B2B context
* Worked for a reputable AML data vendor or have other relevant equivalent experience in data curation & aggregation

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme
* Childcare vouchers

jobs.title: Product Manager - Platform
jobs.description:
We’re in a high-growth stage of our mission here at ComplyAdvantage - to rid the world of financial crime. We’re now adding a Product Manager (who will report to the Onboarding & Monitoring Product Lead) to oversee the development of our Name Screening App & API, and work with engineering teams using state of the art technology to build it.

This is a vital role within the product discipline. Our product managers sit at the heart of our organisation to coordinate multiple stakeholder inputs to define what we build and why. One of our key competitive advantages (and one of the best parts of working here) is our ability to move quickly and build truly customer-centric solutions as we aren’t burdened by politics or bureaucracy.


About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

We are a Fintech50 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fthefintech50.com%2F) startup, and we're ventured backed by two of the world’s best VC firms - Index Ventures and Balderton Capital. We’re quickly scaling the business globally into international markets. To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us.


The team values that we have at ComplyAdvantage subscribe to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace kaizen
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making

What you’ll do:

* Ensure we understand and are addressing our key customer needs in the Name Screening space.
* Identify improvement opportunities for this product.
* Stakeholder management and alignment.
* Create the product roadmap based on input from internal and external stakeholders.
* Be responsible for the strategy, vision and success of our Name Screening App & API
* Report to the product and management team on key performance metrics and strategy.
* Input into Product Marketing for this product.

Requirements

* You will be able to show how you’ve led high-profile initiatives/projects/products and taken an ownership mentality. For example, you may have started something yourself or helped scale a fast-growing company
* You’ve previously synthesised an understanding of client needs and pain points (across a spectrum of sectors and geographies) into an easy-to-understand strategy and roadmap
* Understanding and interrogating user requirements has been second nature to you
* You love nothing more than planning ahead, crafting and interrogating a plan or roadmap for the future, with evidence-based rationale for your decisions
* You can provide examples of successfully managing internal and external stakeholders.
* You're motivated by an insatiable intellectual curiosity and you look to continuously improve

Desirable experience:

* Demonstrated product management skills in a B2B context.
* You have managed end-user facing products

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme
* Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: Product Owner - Data Strategy
jobs.description:
We want to rid the world of money laundering, terrorist financing and bribery & corruption. It's a big goal, but we're well on the way to achieving it - by building out the world’s largest and most comprehensive anti money laundering solution (but that’s really only the start for us).


To move even faster, we're looking for outstanding business analyst/data product-focused leaders to guide the decision-making and roadmap for Product Data Strategy.


The Product Data Strategy Product brings together a number of data collection capabilities across structured data types from Sanction, Politically Exposed People (PEP) and Watchlist data.


We are a Fintech50 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fthefintech50.com%2F) startup, and we're ventured backed by one of Europe's best VC firms - Balderton Capital.

Our Product ethos - does this sound like you?

* You love deeply understanding user needs
* You sit with users, feel their pain and design solutions to fix that pain
* You're motivated by an insatiable intellectual curiosity and you look to continuously improve
* You have an entrepreneurial spirit - you have no need for hand-holding, you own something and take it on and ship products on time
* You appreciate the power of clear, succinct communication

Requirements

What do Product Owners do?

Our Product Owners are the glue that bring our organisation together. They sit in autonomous product teams (made up of product & engineering) where they provide the product point of view to ensure our engineers can work autonomously, with a full understanding of what they’re building and why. You will lead the product voice within a particular technical team and work with other Product Owners to ensure our products match the needs of our users. In this regard you will also work closely with Product Owners who be responsible for the end-to-end product experience for a customer.

We are a Product first company, there’s no politics and we strive to achieve greater things together.


Your previous experience

* It’s likely you’ll have led a software product before (as a Product Manager, founder) and truly enjoyed owning it
* You love nothing more than planning ahead and crafting and interrogating a plan or roadmap for the future, with evidence-based rationale for your decisions
* Understanding and interrogating user requirements has been second nature to you
* Engineers have spoken about your easy-to-understand specifications and how you never dictate direction but build consensus
* Finally, you're probably the type of person who gets passionate about finding and testing obscure edge cases

Career

* Ability to own and craft the technical roadmap in your product area
* Exposure to all parts of the organisation, from CEO to interns
* Huge chance to influence ComplyAdvantage's future direction

What does success look like in the first 12 Months?

* You deeply understand our users and their needs
* You have built the culture and practice of Product throughout the technical teams that you work with - the mindset of "understand, build, measure, improve" is pervasive
* You have shipped the most critical items from your technical product roadmap on time and know from tracking your metrics what to improve on and build next
* You have enabled technical teams to move fast without breaking things

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme
* Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: Product Owner - Media Insights
jobs.description:
We want to rid the world of money laundering, terrorist financing and bribery & corruption. It's a big goal, but we're well on the way to achieving it - by building out the world’s largest and most comprehensive anti money laundering solution (but that’s really only the start for us).


To move even faster, we're looking for outstanding product-focused leaders to guide the decision-making and roadmap for one of our core product teams:

* Media Insights


Our innovative approach to adverse media / negative news screening makes use of cutting-edge machine learning models in extraction, classification, and matching. We are able to cover significantly more media with better insight, and in real time, with ML engineers compared to the manual approaches used by legacy players in this industry. Adverse media is the primary focus of machine learning at ComplyAdvantage, and serves as the basis for our planned growth into other AI-enhanced product offerings.

We are a Fintech50 (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fthefintech50.com%2F) startup, and we're ventured backed by one of Europe's best VC firms - Balderton Capital.

Our Product ethos - does this sound like you?

* You love deeply understanding user needs
* You sit with users, feel their pain and design solutions to fix that pain
* You're motivated by an insatiable intellectual curiosity and you look to continuously improve
* You have an entrepreneurial spirit - you have no need for hand-holding, you own something and take it on and ship products on time
* You appreciate the power of clear, succinct communication

Requirements

What do Product Owners do?

Our Product Owners are the glue that bring our organisation together. They sit in autonomous product teams (made up of product & engineering) where they provide the product point of view to ensure our engineers can work autonomously, with a full understanding of what they’re building and why. You will lead the product voice within a particular technical team and work with other Product Owners to ensure our products match the needs of our users. In this regard you will also work closely with Product Owners who be responsible for the end-to-end product experience for a customer.

We are a Product first company, there’s no politics and we strive to achieve greater things together.

Your previous experience

* It’s likely you’ll have led a software product before as a Product Owner and truly enjoyed owning it
* You love nothing more than planning ahead and crafting and interrogating a plan or roadmap for the future, with evidence-based rationale for your decisions
* Understanding and interrogating user requirements has been second nature to you
* Engineers have spoken about your easy-to-understand specifications and how you never dictate direction but build consensus
* Finally, you're probably the type of person who gets passionate about finding and testing obscure edge cases
* Experience with ML Products or working with ML Engineers, Data Science is desirable

Career

* Ability to own and craft the technical roadmap in your product area
* Exposure to all parts of the organisation, from CEO to interns
* Huge chance to influence ComplyAdvantage's future direction

What does success look like in the first 12 Months?

* You deeply understand our users and their needs
* You have built the culture and practice of Product throughout the technical teams that you work with - the mindset of "understand, build, measure, improve" is pervasive
* You have shipped the most critical items from your technical product roadmap on time and know from tracking your metrics what to improve on and build next
* You have enabled technical teams to move fast without breaking things

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Share options scheme
* Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for skilled and enthusiastic engineers to join our growing number of product engineering teams and provide them with the DevOps capabilities to help build and operate their applications in the cloud. The ability for each development team to fully own and run their products is critical for us to scale efficiently, and as a DevOps-focused team member, you will play a key role in ensuring the success of these projects.

ComplyAdvantage looks to solve some interesting and meaningful problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We are a venture-backed startup using artificial intelligence to fight terrorism and financial crime. We have a desire to reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology and to disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

We are a SaaS-first company with development, QA and production systems all deployed on AWS. An effective DevOps culture is essential in allowing us to continue to grow rapidly and give development teams the autonomy to deploy their work into production.

At ComplyAdvantage, we believe in DevOps principles, and practicing DevOps culture across our engineering and product organisations. To us, DevOps is much more than a job title (and some would say that it shouldn't be a job title!). The DevOps chapter at ComplyAdvantage consists of two main groups:

* Engineers working in our CloudOps team, who focus on the core AWS infrastructure, shared platforms and CI systems.
* Engineers working within our development squads, focused on the individual project requirements for production, CI, testing, and development environments.

As members of the DevOps chapter, we work together towards the common goal of accelerating the software development lifecycle as the company grows, by sharing knowledge, decision making, and great working practices.

Your team will typically consist of colleagues working in a variety of roles, such as developers, machine learning engineers, QA engineers, analysts, and product managers. Together you will take responsibility for building and delivering products and features, from the specification stage, through to the ongoing monitoring of the live applications.

Are you passionate about DevOps as a culture? Would you like to be a critical part of seeing it integrated as a practice throughout a number of high performing development teams?

Key Responsibilities

* Working with one of the development squads in Cluj, to focus on DevOps-related tasks:
* Building out required infrastructure using Infrastructure-as-Code principles (we use Terraform)
* Build and maintain CI pipelines.
* Build and maintain environments as required, eg dev environments, QA, staging and Production.
* Make use of centralised infrastructure to reduce "heavy lifting", eg centralised Kubernetes deployments and Kafka clusters, AWS resources
* Contribute your knowledge and experience to the DevOps chapter and wider product and engineering organisations
* Historically many of these elements have been guided by the CloudOps team, but in the true spirit of DevOps, we would like the ownership of these parts of the projects to move back to the team working on the project. This enables us to scale the teams out efficiently, and gives team much more autonomy in building and running their projects.

What does success look like in the first 12 Months?

* You will have a firm grasp on the current development and deployment requirements of your team’s project(s)
* You will have embarked on process of continuous improvement in your team, reducing cycle time and work in process, but making deployments easier and safer
* You should have your team well on the way to full ownership and operation of their projects/services.

Requirements


* Python or a compiled language as part of their professional work.
* Experience of working with a public cloud and some form of automation or infrastructure-as-code work (eg, terraform, cloudformation, ansible, chef)
* Professional experience using docker and git


Within this role you will be embedded with one or more of our engineering teams, assisting them in building out and continuously improving their CI pipelines. You will also work with our London-based DevOps team in ensuring we adopt and maintain a consistent approach to the work we do across different teams and offices. Occasional travel to London is expected.

We work with an extensive technology stack, including AWS, docker, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and Hadoop. If you would like to as well, then we'd love to hear from you.

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme
* Generous annual leave arrangements

jobs.title: Senior Front-end Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented Senior Front-end Engineer to lead the design and implementation of the front-end of our transaction monitoring platform. You'll take ownership for the technical guidance of the project - designing, planning and ensuring the best technologies and tools are used for the job.


About us

Every day we look to solve highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

To achieve this, we are significantly growing our team and we need the best people onboard to help us do this.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.

The role

* You will be responsible for designing and implementing the client-side of our cutting-edge anti money-laundering platform
* You'll work out clear and interesting ways of presenting complex and sophisticated numeric and qualitative data to decision makers
* The role includes technology and framework selection, architecture and implementation
* You'll collaborate closely with our product and design teams and back-end engineers

What does success look like In your first 12 months?

* You have taken co-ownership of the Transaction Monitoring project and all stages of the front end development process. You have delivered new features and improvements on time with outstanding quality.
* You have gained a deep understanding of the users, business and technology beyond the project. You are always mindful of quality attributes like maintainability, performance, security, scalability, usability and testability. As a result, you have successfully contributed to architecture and UI/UX proposals and decisions.
* Your designs and implementation are clean, elegant, and easily understood by other team members. You add complexity where it is needed, but no more than what is required.
* You are continuously researching tools, technologies, frameworks and practices. You are able to distinguish between what is hyped and what is valuable, and you have pertinent arguments in favor of your proposals.
* You can guide the team towards the established objectives. Your colleagues have come to value your technical advice, and you are able to identify technical and soft skills areas that need improving. You have been actively mentoring team members to improve their skills and expand their knowledge base.

Requirements

We value those who take initiative and pride in their work and contribute to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

* Extensive experience working with JavaScript including knowledge of one or more front-end frameworks such as Angular.js, React etc...
* A sound understanding of Javascript application best practices.
* The ability to build a client-side application to enterprise grade
* Most likely a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or other numerate field.

Benefits

Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days' holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solutions. We are building solutions that help reveal the truth for a safer world and stop money ending up in the hands of terrorists.

How? By bringing together smart technology, data and people into a single solution. We are building tools that fight financial crime today to prevent a riskier tomorrow.


About us

Every day we look to tackle highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web-based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing our Series B investment round of $30mln led by Index Ventures and tripling our revenue year-on-year, we’re growing fast and are looking for the best people to join us.

Our culture

Fresh Thinkers - We’re big thinking, boundary breakers, providing innovative solutions not corporate fixes.

Problem Solvers - We’re constantly curious and instinctively clever, always striving to be faster and better.

People People - We’re the human side of risk and compliance, we care about the people behind the screens.


The role

We are looking for an expert engineer to join our Knowledge Graph team. You’ll have experience developing systems at scale and handling large volumes of data.

* You will be responsible for delivering the data ingest pipeline to transform and enrich various data sources into a graph format, ultimately loading to a Graph Database.
* You will be responsible for implementing components of the ingest pipeline to run with a cloud deployed microservices architecture.
* You will be a strong believer in DevOps and are comfortable with getting into the details of infrastructure and deployment. You’ll also be responsible for lead on tech projects and deployments.
* You will provide leadership, coaching and mentoring to more junior engineers and help them to become as good as you are.
*

What does success look like after 3 months?

* You have total ownership of ingestion pipelines and you have strengthened the software engineering skillset.
* You have implemented the high-level architecture and worked on existing POC services to flesh out the ingestion pipeline into the graph DB.
* You have supervised other team members and provided them with the support and coaching for them to grow.
* You have implemented the best practises around software delivery to the team and own Infrastructure needs.

Requirements

We’re looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

* You have extensive knowledge of data structures, algorithms, complexity and optimisation strategies
* You’ll be a solid programmer with experience in a mainstream language (Python, C++, Java, etc)
* You will have worked on cloud based systems and ideally be familiar with cloud technologies and containers
* You have worked with data processing technologies, such as (but not limited to!) MapReduce, Spark e.g. XML/JSON parsers
* Ideally you will have experience working on software systems at scale with large amounts of complex data

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days' holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme

Every day we look to tackle highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web-based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal money transfers. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing our Series B investment round of $30mln led by Index Ventures and tripling our revenue year-on-year, we’re growing fast and are looking for the best people to join us.

Our culture

Fresh Thinkers - We’re big thinking, boundary breakers, providing innovative solutions not corporate fixes.

Problem Solvers - We’re constantly curious and instinctively clever, always striving to be faster and better.

People People - We’re the human side of risk and compliance, we care about the people behind the screens.

The role

We are looking for an expert engineer to join our Knowledge Graph team. You’ll have experience developing systems at scale and handling large volumes of data.

  • You will be responsible for delivering the data ingest pipeline to transform and enrich various data sources into a graph format, ultimately loading to a Graph Database.
  • You will be responsible for implementing components of the ingest pipeline to run with a cloud deployed microservices architecture.
  • You will be a strong believer in DevOps and are comfortable with getting into the details of infrastructure and deployment. You’ll also be responsible for lead on tech projects and deployments.
  • You will provide leadership, coaching and mentoring to more junior engineers and help them to become as good as you are. *

What does success look like after 3 months?

  • You have total ownership of ingestion pipelines and you have strengthened the software engineering skillset.
  • You have implemented the high-level architecture and worked on existing POC services to flesh out the ingestion pipeline into the graph DB.
  • You have supervised other team members and provided them with the support and coaching for them to grow.
  • You have implemented the best practises around software delivery to the team and own Infrastructure needs.

Requirements

We’re looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

  • You have extensive knowledge of data structures, algorithms, complexity and optimisation strategies
  • You’ll be a solid programmer with experience in a mainstream language (Python, C++, Java, etc)
  • You will have worked on cloud based systems and ideally be familiar with cloud technologies and containers
  • You have worked with data processing technologies, such as (but not limited to!) MapReduce, Spark e.g. XML/JSON parsers
  • Ideally you will have experience working on software systems at scale with large amounts of complex data

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Share options scheme
  • 25 days' holiday
  • Flexible working hours
  • Company pension scheme
  • Company health care plan
  • Season ticket loan
  • Cycle to work scheme

People People - We’re the human side of risk and compliance, we care about the people behind the screens.

The role

We are looking for an expert engineer to join our Transaction Monitoring team. You’ll have experience developing systems at scale and handling large volumes of data.

* You will be responsible for working with the engineering and product teams to design, implement and support features and components for our transaction monitoring platform.
* You will be responsible in developing various REST framework services handling large volumes of data.
* You will complete refactoring of existing code-base into discrete sub-components services.
* You will work with databases at scale and provide solutions as appropriate
* You will effectively communicate the relevant updates and queries with designers, the product team and other development teams on the project
* You will understand, extend and modify complex logic with many technical dependencies and consequences.
* You will supervise other developers on the team

What does success look like after 3 months?

* You have helped refactor and migrate existing complex application to better defined services and components.
* You have supervised other team members and provided them with the support and coaching for them to grow.
* You have implemented the best practises around software delivery to the team and own Infrastructure needs.
* You have implemented features related to enhanced screening rules, entity resolution, multi-tenant security and other roadmap features.
* You have made several high-quality, tested contributions to the code-base that are in use by clients on production environments.

Requirements

We’re looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

* You have extensive knowledge of data structures, algorithms, complexity and optimisation strategies
* You’ll be a solid programmer with experience in a mainstream language, ideally Python
* You have worked with data processing technologies, such as (but not limited to!) MapReduce, Spark e.g. XML/JSON parsers
* You have prior leadership experience and you're familiar with dealing with stakeholders and managing developers
* You will have experience working on software systems at scale with large amounts of complex data
* Most likely minimum degree-level education in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or relevant

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options scheme
* 25 days' holiday
* Flexible working hours
* Company pension scheme
* Company health care plan
* Season ticket loan
* Cycle to work scheme

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented Software Engineer to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solutions.


About us

Every day we look to tackle highly interesting and challenging problems that can help people better live their lives free from fraud, corruption, money laundering and terrorist financing. We have developed modern, web-based applications that allow our growing list of international clients to detect, and ultimately prevent, illegal financial activities. We reduce crime and criminal activity through the creative use of technology & design and disrupt the compliance industry while doing so.

After securing our Series B investment round of $30m led by Index Ventures and tripling our revenue year-on-year, we’re growing fast and are looking for the best people to join us.

The team values that ComplyAdvantage subscribes to include:

* Continuous improvement - try new things, take risks, embrace failure!
* Go the extra mile - we succeed as a team, and share our achievements and failures
* Results driven - focus on the goals, and be hungry to win.
* Inclusion - be respectful, friendly and include others in decision making.

The role

We are looking for a talented software engineer to join our AML Screening and Monitoring team. You’ll have experience developing systems at scale and handling large volumes of data.

* Responsible for working with the engineering team and product to design, implement and support features and components for our screening platform.
* Responsible in developing various REST framework services handling large volumes of data.
* You will iterate over the existing codebase to enhance with new components and features in order to address some of the enterprise grade requirements.
* You will work with databases at scale and provide solutions as appropriate
* Effectively communicate the relevant updates and queries with other stakeholders (designers, delivery, product and other team members)
* Understand, extend and modify complex logic with many technical dependencies and consequences.
* You will be a strong believer in DevOps and are comfortable with getting into the details of infrastructure and deployment
* You will own your code - you build it, you ship it, you run it - and you will be a champion of this throughout the team or teams you work with.

What does success look like after 3 months?

* You will have a clear overview of the screening platform codebase and components that your squad will be working on
* You have a good understanding of the product business and technical roadmap and the initiatives around making screening platform an enterprise grade solution and technical implications around these.
* You have made several high-quality, tested contributions to the code-base that are in use by clients on production environments.

Requirements

We’re looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, taking into account the following:

* Very good knowledge of data structures, algorithms, complexity and optimisation strategies
* Whilst this position will require you to work in Python, previous experience is not required - if you're a strong developer in Java, C++, C# or .NET and are willing to switch languages, then we'd love to hear from you.
* Experience with MongoDB, ElasticSearch or some other distributed data storage system.
* Strong understanding of code development principles and practices, including source control, code reviews, testing, etc.
* Bachelor degree-level education in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar relevant degree preferred

Benefits

Benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include:

* Competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Generous annual leave arrangements
* Private health insurance
* Meal tickets
* Share options scheme

jobs.title: UI Designer
jobs.description:
Create the visual design for digital products (used to make complex decisions by financial services organisations)

* Use visual design to clearly communicate fundamental concepts such as visual hierarchy and navigation
* Detailed design tasks such as selecting colours, pairing typefaces, and setting web page or app menu layouts
* Ability to deliver pixel-precise visual designs and assets using common industry tools e.g. Adobe Photoshop, Sketch or others
* Knowledge of common standards and guidelines for UI design, including responsive design, WAI accessibility guidelines


Create consistent templates for UI layout, navigation and content

* Interpret correct use of branding guidelines in the UI context - extend rather than be constrained by these in creating suitable standards for UI design
* Experience of working with and creating assets for pattern libraries/design systems used by UX designers and developers
* Awareness of the design challenges of work systems- how designing for people at work differs from B2C and app design.


Work alongside UX designers to explore design problems, implement findings from user research and refine solutions

* Ability to collaborate on solutions in hand-drawn sketches and low fidelity wireframes
* Observe user research and absorb outputs, synthesize into design solutions
* Experience creating rapid prototypes for testing using tools such as Sketch, Axure, etc


Work alongside developers, product managers, marketing, content writers etc. to create and implement suitable solutions - this role requires real cross team collaboration

* Deliver timely visual design solutions (e.g. visualisations and build assets) in suitable formats for implementation by developers
* Experience delivering work as part of sprint-based teams
* Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, javascript – ability to work in these a plus

Requirements

We would like to see concrete examples of:

* Work in B2B or enterprise technology environments - not just B2C marketing sites and mobile apps
* Taking a digital design project from early conceptual design through to build
* Examples of working in Agile, or pseudo Agile environments
* Evidence of working closely with developers and other team members
